item.title: Durability of resistance to Meloidogyne mediated by R-genes in Solanaceae and Cucurbitaceae crops
item.author: helio4gm@gmail.com (Helio)
item.description: General introduction Meloidogyne spp. Biology Economic importance Population dynamics and yield losses Plant resistance Watermelon Importance Origin Cultivation challenges Grafting Eggplant Importance Origin Cultivation challenges Grafting Objectives Response of two Citrullus amarus accessions to isolates of three species of Meloidogyne and their graft compatibility with watermelon Introduction Materials and methods Nematode inoculum Response of C. amarus accessions to RKN isolates Experiment under plastic greenhouse Grafting compatibility and fruit quality Statistical analysis Results Pot experiments Experiment under plastic greenhouse Grafting compatibility and fruit quality Discussion Conclusion Acknowledgments Effect of Citrullus amarus accessions on the population dynamics of Meloidogyne incognita and M.
item.dc:creator: Helio
